title: How to Make a Scrambled Egg and Biscuit Sandwich

steps.headline: Cut up half of a flavorful medium-sized onion.
Cut up two slices of thinly-sliced lunch meat.
Put some butter in the pan, and melt it.
Put half of the sliced ingredients into the frying pan, and let them sizzle for a while.
While they are cooking, scramble the eggs in a bowl.
Add the eggs to the pan

steps.headline: When eggs are 3/4 done, add remaining onion and lunch meat.
Put the eggs on a bagel, English muffin or biscuit and enjoy!

text:
Use two eggs per person. Cut up half of a flavorful medium-sized onion. Cut up two slices of thinly-sliced lunch meat. Put some butter in the pan, and melt it. Put half of the sliced ingredients into the frying pan, and let them sizzle for a while. While they are cooking, scramble the eggs in a bowl. Add the eggs to the pan Immediately stir. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Make-a-Delicious-Egg-Biscuit-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Delicious-Egg-Biscuit-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Make-a-Delicious-Egg-Biscuit-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Delicious-Egg-Biscuit-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} When eggs are 3/4 done, add remaining onion and lunch meat. Cook to desired texture. Put the eggs on a bagel, English muffin or biscuit and enjoy! Finished.
